intro: Fagara mezoneurispinosa, commonly known as the spiny fagara, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, compound leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
